name: **Inishraher**
description: Inishraher L924-850 Sheet 31 Outfarmed, perhaps best landed upon away from the one summer dwelling at NE point above a lovely swimmable beach. Land perhaps therefore in the SW, below a man-made cut through the cliff above. Poor camping. Sheep. Flagpost and bunting on summit. Inishraher is unfortunately a victim of the 2008+ Irish recession. It suffers the hideous eyesore of an abandoned building site, that boasts the grand name of the “Clew Bay Centre for World Peace”. This consists of 8 unfinished buildings and associated crud which sadly make the nice beach on the E side somewhat less attractive.
